{{ja-kanjitab|しん|こう|こく|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しんこうこく|新興|tr1=shinkō|t1=burgeoning, rising|国|tr2=koku|t2=country}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|し|んこ|うこく}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕĩŋko̞ː ko̞kɯᵝ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しんこう こく}}

# [[emerging]] country, newly [[industrialized]] country
# {{lb|ja|sort=しんこうこく|dated}} a newly [[independent]] country, no longer a [[colony]]

====Usage notes====
A country labeled as a {{lang|ja|新興国}} in Japanese could be deemed in English to be either an emerging country or a newly industrialized country, or even both, depending on the context.

The sense of ''no longer a colony'' is no longer used in modern contexts.

* {{ja-l|後進国|こうしんこく|kōshin koku}} [[developing]] country {{qualifier|less common; literally, ''“backward country”}}
